annotation.summary: Archetypes let players expand and personalize their characters by combining features from multiple classes.
annotation.prerequisites: character must meet requirements for multiple classes

annotation.summary: Characters can gain an archetype by choosing archetype feats instead of their normal class feats. The process begins by selecting an archetype and taking its dedication feat using a class feat slot. After obtaining the dedication feat, the character can take additional feats from that archetype if they meet the prerequisites. Archetype feats typically replace class feats and are referred to as archetype class feats.
annotation.action_economy: None (character advancement choice, not an in-play action)
annotation.prerequisites: Must select an archetype and take its dedication feat before choosing other feats from that archetype.

annotation.summary: When a character takes a dedication feat for an archetype, they commit to that archetype and cannot take another dedication feat until they have taken two additional feats from the same archetype. Dedication feats also cannot be retrained while any feats from that archetype remain.
annotation.action_economy: None (applies to character build choices, not actions in play)
annotation.prerequisites: Must meet the requirements for the chosen archetype's dedication feat

annotation.summary: Multiclass archetypes let a character gain abilities from another class, but you cannot take a multiclass dedication feat for a class you already belong to.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must not already be a member of the class associated with the multiclass archetype.

annotation.summary: Archetypes may list additional feats from other sources with adjusted levels. These feats can be taken as archetype feats, counting toward the archetype’s dedication requirements, and lose any class-specific traits when selected this way.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have the archetype's dedication feat to select additional feats from its list.

annotation.summary: Archetype feats that grant another feat still require you to meet that feat’s prerequisites, and the combined selection counts as only one feat toward your archetype dedication.
annotation.prerequisites: Must meet the prerequisites of any feat gained through an archetype feat.

annotation.summary: Archetypes that provide spellcasting grant delayed access to spells compared to full spellcasting classes, but still allow the character to use items that require the ability to cast spells.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have an archetype that grants spellcasting

annotation.summary: Spellcasting archetypes provide cantrips through their dedication feat and progress through basic, expert, and master spellcasting feats named after the archetype. The spell slots gained follow the archetype’s specific restrictions, such as limiting the type of spells that can be cast based on the archetype’s chosen features.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this section describes progression and limitations, not actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Must take the archetype’s dedication feat to gain cantrips and access subsequent spellcasting feats.

annotation.summary: The Basic Spellcasting Feat provides progressive spellcasting benefits, granting a 1st-rank spell slot at 4th level, a 2nd-rank slot at 6th level, and a 3rd-rank slot at 8th level. If the character has a spell repertoire, they can designate one spell as a signature spell. Archetypes reference these as the basic spellcasting benefits.
annotation.prerequisites: Character level 4 or higher

annotation.summary: The Expert Spellcasting Feat enhances a character’s spellcasting ability, improving spell attack rolls and DCs, granting higher-rank spell slots at specific levels, and allowing an additional signature spell if the character uses a spell repertoire.
annotation.prerequisites: Typically available at 12th level; requires existing spellcasting ability.

annotation.summary: The Master Spellcasting Feat, typically gained at 18th level, enhances a character’s spellcasting by improving spell attack modifiers and DCs, granting a 7th-rank spell slot, and allowing a third signature spell if the character has a spell repertoire. At 20th level, it also provides an 8th-rank spell slot. Archetypes reference these as master spellcasting benefits.
annotation.prerequisites: 18th level; ability to cast spells

annotation.summary: Archetype feats with the skill trait can replace skill feats instead of class feats, and skill feats still count toward dedication requirements. Some class archetypes can alter class abilities from 1st level, but a character can only have one class archetype at a time.
annotation.prerequisites: Must meet the dedication requirements; cannot already have a class archetype.

annotation.summary: Operative envoys gain enhanced precision in combat, allowing them to combine the Aim action with abilities such as Get 'em! and Distant Feint. Ghost operatives benefit from additional feats that leverage Deception.
annotation.action_economy: Combines Aim with other abilities (standard or move actions depending on ability)
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be an operative envoy or ghost operative with access to Aim, Get 'em!, or Distant Feint abilities.

annotation.summary: Describes the Solarian envoy archetype as an inspiring battlefield leader who can adapt their abilities by selecting different Athletics feats suited to the terrain using Adaptive Talent.
annotation.action_economy: Varies depending on the chosen Athletics feats; not explicitly stated in the paragraph.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be a Solarian envoy with access to Adaptive Talent and eligible Athletics feats.

annotation.summary: Soldier envoys excel as battlefield leaders who maintain their directive bonuses against strong foes while using area attacks to eliminate weaker enemies. Those with scholarly or tactical training can further enhance their effectiveness through intimidation-based feats such as Quip and Cut 'em Deep.
annotation.action_economy: Standard actions for area attacks; ongoing or passive effects for maintaining directive bonuses.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to envoy directives and proficiency with Intimidation feats like Quip and Cut 'em Deep.

annotation.summary: This heading indicates a section describing a dedication feat that allows a character to multiclass into another archetype.
annotation.prerequisites: varies by specific archetype dedication

annotation.summary: The character obtains the adaptive talent class feature but does not receive extra skill feats as they level up.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to a class or option that grants adaptive talent

annotation.summary: This rule allows a character to take the feat again at levels 10 and 16, each time gaining one additional skill feat through adaptive talent.
This heading indicates a section describing a dedication feat that allows a character to multiclass into another archetype.
annotation.prerequisites: Varies by archetype; typically requires a minimum level or specific class features.

annotation.summary: The feature grants the ability to cast spells as a mystic, including the Cast a Spell activity, a repertoire of two common cantrips from the connection’s spell list or tradition, training in spell attack rolls and DCs, and establishes Wisdom as the key spellcasting attribute for mystic spells.
annotation.action_economy: Cast a Spell activity (typically 2 actions, varies by spell)
annotation.prerequisites: Must have access to the mystic archetype or connection granting this feature

annotation.summary: A foundational feat that grants a character access to basic mystic spellcasting abilities, typically allowing them to learn and cast low-level spells.
annotation.action_economy: Varies depending on the spell cast; generally follows standard spellcasting actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Character level 4 or higher; may require a mystic class or similar magical aptitude.

annotation.summary: Grants basic spellcasting benefits and allows the character to add a new spell to their repertoire whenever they gain a spell slot of a new rank from the mystic archetype, choosing from common spells or granted spells of their connection's tradition.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have the mystic archetype and gain a spell slot of a new rank.

annotation.summary: This section lists the requirement needed before a character can access or use the described ability.
annotation.prerequisites: Basic Mystic Spellcasting

annotation.summary: This rule increases both the number of spells known and the number of spell slots gained from mystic archetype feats by one for each spell rank except the two highest ranks.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have mystic archetype feats that grant spell slots.

annotation.summary: A feat available at level 12 that enhances a mystic's spellcasting capabilities to an expert level, improving proficiency and effectiveness with spells.
The ability requires the character to have basic mystic spellcasting capabilities and to be a master in the relevant connection skill.
The character obtains the benefits associated with expert-level spellcasting as described elsewhere in the rulebook.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have access to spellcasting and meet the requirements for expert spellcasting.

annotation.summary: A high-level feat (level 18) that enhances or expands a mystic character’s spellcasting abilities, likely granting access to more powerful spells or improved casting efficiency.
annotation.prerequisites: likely requires prior mystic spellcasting feats or class features

annotation.summary: The ability requires the character to possess Expert-level Mystic Spellcasting and a legendary proficiency in the Connection skill.
The character acquires the master-level spellcasting benefits as detailed on page 174 of the rulebook.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the master spellcasting feature or level as specified on page 174.

annotation.summary: The operative archetype focuses on dealing significant damage to a single target and provides access to class feats and exploits that enhance offensive combat capabilities.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by selected feats and exploits; generally uses standard attack actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Must qualify for the operative archetype as defined by the game's archetype rules.

annotation.summary: Witchwarper operatives use their agility and spatial manipulation abilities to disrupt opponents through a combination of mobility and quantum powers.
annotation.action_economy: Standard action or movement-based ability, depending on specific feat usage.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have levels in both Witchwarper and Operative classes or equivalent abilities granting quantum field and mobility feats.

annotation.summary: This heading indicates a section describing a dedication feat that allows a character to multiclass into another archetype.
annotation.prerequisites: Varies by specific archetype dedication; typically requires a minimum level and no prior dedication feats.

annotation.summary: When you select additional Operative archetype class feats, you gain extra Hit Points each time you do so.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have the Operative archetype and at least one Operative class feat.

annotation.summary: This feature grants the character the exploit associated with their selected operative specialization.
This entry lists the requirements needed before selecting or using a specific ability or feat.
prerequisites: Expert proficiency in any weapon or unarmed attack

annotation.summary: The ability requires the character to have the Operative Dedication feat and be at least an expert in Perception.
This feature requires the character to have the Operative Dedication feat and belong to a class that provides no more than 6 plus their Constitution modifier hit points per level.
prerequisites: Class with ≤ 6 + Constitution hit points per level

annotation.summary: The solarian archetype grants characters the ability to create and use solar weapons for melee combat.
annotation.action_economy: Varies depending on specific solar weapon abilities; generally uses standard combat actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must select the solarian archetype.

annotation.summary: Close quarters operatives can leverage a solarian’s mobility and gravity-defying abilities, even though most operative features don’t combine with solarian manifestations.
annotation.action_economy: Passive interaction; no specific action cost described.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have levels in both the operative and solarian classes.

annotation.summary: This heading indicates a section describing a dedication feat that allows a character to multiclass into another archetype.
annotation.prerequisites: varies by specific archetype dedication

annotation.summary: The feature requires that the character already possess the Solarian Dedication and belong to a class that provides no more than 8 plus their Constitution modifier in Hit Points per level.
prerequisites: Class with ≤ 8 + Constitution modifier Hit Points per level

annotation.summary: The character gains 3 extra Hit Points for every solarian archetype class feat they possess, and continues to gain more as they acquire additional feats of that archetype.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have at least one solarian archetype class feat.

annotation.summary: The ability requires the character to have the Solarian Dedication feat and be an expert with at least one weapon or unarmed attack.
prerequisites: Expert proficiency in any weapon or unarmed attack

annotation.summary: The soldier archetype focuses on characters who excel at performing area attacks.
annotation.prerequisites: None stated

annotation.summary: This heading indicates a section describing a multiclass dedication archetype, which grants access to another class's abilities through the archetype system.
annotation.prerequisites: varies by specific archetype dedication

annotation.summary: This feature requires the character to have the Soldier Dedication and belong to a class that provides no more than 8 plus their Constitution modifier in Hit Points per level.
prerequisites: Class with ≤ 8 + Constitution modifier Hit Points per level

annotation.summary: The character gains 3 extra Hit Points for every soldier archetype class feat they possess, and this bonus increases as they acquire more such feats.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have at least one soldier archetype class feat.

annotation.summary: The ability requires the character to have the Soldier Dedication feat and be an expert in Fortitude saves.
This heading indicates a section describing a dedication feat that allows a character to multiclass into another archetype.
annotation.prerequisites: Varies by archetype; typically requires a minimum level and sometimes specific class features.

annotation.summary: Grants limited witchwarper spellcasting ability, including access to the Cast a Spell activity, a repertoire of two cantrips from the paradox's tradition, and training in spell attack rolls and DCs using Intelligence as the key attribute. No other paradox abilities are gained.
annotation.action_economy: Cast a Spell activity (varies by spell)
annotation.prerequisites: Must have access to the witchwarper archetype or a paradox granting spellcasting

annotation.summary: This section specifies that the character must have the Witchwarper Dedication feat before selecting or using this ability.
This section specifies that the feature or ability requires the Witchwarper Dedication before it can be selected or used.
This entry specifies that the ability or feat requires the Witchwarper Dedication before it can be selected or used.
This entry introduces the Basic Witchwarper Spellcasting feat, a level 4 feature that grants access to fundamental spellcasting abilities for the Witchwarper class.
annotation.action_economy: varies depending on the spell cast
annotation.prerequisites: Witchwarper class

annotation.summary: This section specifies that the ability or feat requires the Witchwarper Dedication before it can be selected or used.
Grants basic spellcasting benefits and allows the character to add a new spell of the appropriate rank to their repertoire whenever they gain a new spell slot from the witchwarper archetype.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the witchwarper archetype and a paradox tradition.

annotation.summary: This entry specifies that a character must already possess the Basic Witchwarper Spellcasting feature before selecting or using the related ability.
annotation.prerequisites: Basic Witchwarper Spellcasting

annotation.summary: The character gains additional spell repertoire and spell slots from witchwarper archetype feats, adding one extra spell and slot for each spell rank except the two highest ranks.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have witchwarper archetype feats and access to spellcasting of the paradox's tradition.

annotation.summary: A level 12 feat that enhances a Witchwarper’s spellcasting capabilities, granting access to higher-level spells or improved casting proficiency.
annotation.prerequisites: Witchwarper spellcasting class feature

annotation.summary: The ability requires the character to already possess basic Witchwarper spellcasting and to have achieved master proficiency in either Arcana or Occultism, depending on their chosen paradox.
prerequisites: Master in Arcana or Occultism (depending on paradox)

annotation.summary: The character obtains the benefits associated with expert-level spellcasting as described elsewhere in the rulebook.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to or qualification for expert spellcasting benefits

annotation.summary: An 18th-level feat that enhances a Witchwarper's spellcasting abilities, likely improving spell slots, access to higher-level spells, or other advanced magical features.
annotation.action_economy: Varies depending on the specific spell or ability used; typically follows standard spellcasting actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Witchwarper class, level 18

annotation.summary: The ability requires the character to have expert-level Witchwarper spellcasting and legendary proficiency in either Arcana or Occultism, depending on their chosen paradox.
prerequisites: Legendary proficiency in Arcana or Occultism (depending on paradox)

annotation.summary: The character acquires the master-level spellcasting benefits as described on page 174 of the rulebook.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the master spellcasting benefits section (page 174)

annotation.summary: At 4th level, the character gains the Danger Awareness feat as an additional feat option.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be 4th level.

annotation.summary: This entry introduces the Starfinder Field Agent Dedication feat, available at level 2, which likely grants access to abilities and benefits associated with being a Starfinder field agent.
annotation.prerequisites: None listed

annotation.summary: This heading indicates a section describing a dedication feat that allows a character to multiclass into another archetype.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must meet the requirements for taking a dedication feat, typically level and attribute prerequisites.

annotation.summary: This rule allows a character with the xenoarchaeologist archetype dedication to take this feat without meeting the usual requirement of having two additional archetype feats. It also establishes that xenoarchaeologist and Starfinder field agent archetype feats count interchangeably for fulfilling archetype progression requirements.
annotation.prerequisites: Xenoarchaeologist archetype dedication feat

annotation.summary: This entry specifies that the character must have the Starfinder Field Agent Dedication before selecting or using this option.
This entry specifies that the character must have the Starfinder Field Agent Dedication before selecting or using this option.
This entry specifies that the character must have the Starfinder Field Agent Dedication before selecting this option.
This entry specifies that the character must have the Starfinder Field Agent Dedication before selecting or using this ability or feat.
